duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and implement strategies that grow trusted-advisor relationships and facilitate an exceptional client experience.

Serve as the hub of the account team for 1-2 key client accounts, working with the Client Leads to support strategic execution and liaising with the client’s legal operations teams and other key contacts.
Lead and track multiple, complex sets of client relationship activities including RFPs and other new business opportunities, secondments, client events, and custom client marketing efforts.
Collaborate with Client Leads and other team leaders to ensure processes and systems efficiently and effectively deliver an excellent client experience.
Develop and provide regular client relationship reporting focused on key metrics, strategic actions, impact, client satisfaction, etc. for both firm leadership and the client team.
Manage and mentor staff, overseeing personnel issues, workload, and professional development of staff.
Work with finance and pricing teams to understand client requirements, account financial metrics, and pricing arrangements.
Plan and lead recurring internal team meetings, managing agenda preparation and tracking follow-up items.
Develop and maintain onboarding for new attorneys to the client team.

skills.skill: Exceptional organizational and project management skills
Proficient in budgeting, reporting, and application of financial metrics
Operate effectively in a hybrid work environment

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required. Master’s degree (MBA, MA, MS JD, or other relevant graduate degree) preferred. Minimum of 10 years experience in strategic account management, complex program, and/or direct client service experience in a professional services environment, or similarly relevant business experience is preferred.
